programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Josh Byrne takes us on a tour of WAs best wildflowers, Sophie Thomson visits a date farm, Millie Ross and Squid go hunting for truffles and Tino Carnevale checks out the giant pumpkins at an old-style country show.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: End Game with Tony Armstrong
programme.desc: In the final episode of End Game with Tony Armstrong, Tony returns to Australia to ask whether lessons from abroad can help tackle racism in sport.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The sitting week concludes with coverage of Question Time from the Senate. Parliament resumes on Monday 24 November.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Ann Melbourne found her birth mother but a relationship did not develop. But this hasnt stopped Ann wanting to find her birth father. Meanwhile, professional dancer Amanda Village is on the trail of her mother, Susan.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week concludes with coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives. Parliament resumes on Monday 24 November.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Millie Ross suggests Aussie plants to grow indoors, Costa Georgiadis discovers some rare camellias, Jerry Coleby-Williams meets a Tillandsia expert and Jane Edmanson discovers great food can be grown in tough spaces.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based On Lies
programme.desc: Alice travels into the past in search of answers in the present as she becomes more isolated in her investigation. A surprising turn of events makes her hopeful that justice will finally be served.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Acclaimed Australian architect Ed Lippmann discovers transforming his childhood home into a signature steel and glass showpiece may be the most daunting assignment of his storied career.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Mediterranean Living and Super Soil
programme.desc: Costa supercharges vegie soil, Jane explores a cemetery enlivened with wildflowers, Josh finds a tranquil Mediterranean courtyard, Tammy gets advice on growing desert peas, and we meet a sculptor creating lifelike plants.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Its another classic lineup of Hard Quiz expert topics on the hunt for the Big Brass Mug! Tonight, its Queen Victorias Children, TV series Red Dwarf, NRL team the Sydney Roosters... and would you believe, sewage!

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Spicks returns with Ross Wilson, Andrea Lam, Ali McGregor, Frank Woodly and Urvi Majumdar all joining our favourite regulars Adam, Alan and Myf. Paul Kelly also belts out his sequel to How to Make Gravy.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Dungeons Of Dreadrock Review and Earthworm Jims Origin Story!
programme.desc: We puzzle our way through our review of Dungeons Of Dreadrock, plus we dig into the Origin Story of gamings most famous worm, Earthworm Jim!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand takes to the throne when Dr Chris sets him the impossible task of being Mini-Xands pituitary gland. Things get competitive in Ouchology and Dr Ronx meets dental patients to find out more about braces.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Monarch entrusts an akumatized villain with the power of Jubilation, which shows people their deepest desires. Will Ladybug and Cat Noir escape that dangerous power?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzers kennel is accidentally destroyed. He hopes the Farmer will replace it with a new deluxe model. When he sees his masters clumsy attempt to build a new kennel, Bitzer is so horrified he packs his bags and leaves home.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand arm wrestles the worlds strongest woman to help find out how muscles grow. And the doctors reveal the Top 5 Bizarre Things Your Body Can Do!

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: A penguin stuck in molt for a year has hopefully seen the last of his bad hair days.

programme.title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
programme.desc: Constance gets the kids closer to finding the compromised Mr. Benedict by using her gift.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Roller Champions Review and Tackling Our Pile Of Shame!
programme.desc: We skate through the roller derby inspired action of Roller Champions, plus we finally tackle our pile of shame and take a look at Hoa, Heavenly Bodies, and Grow: Song Of The Evertree!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a tug of war in todays lab as the doctors show the incredible strength of your ligaments. Spot the disappearing head in Mindbenders and Dr Xand meets a dad and his son making bionic hands in their living room.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A secret network at school is determined to find out how Monarchs new power works by deliberately triggering an akumatization. Would Ladybug and Cat Noir agree with such a plan?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer gets Bitzer to help him renovate an old boat, but as soon as his back is turned the sheep and pigs turn the refurbishment into a swashbuckling game of pirates!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi help Raxlo recover his stolen harvester.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing through brutal group battles and fierce head-to-heads for a place in the heat final are Aftershock, Nuts 2, Jellyfish, Rapid, Sabretooth, TMHWK, Terrorhurtz and Crank-E. Let battle commence!

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Ben gets up Officially early to join a coach full of record attempters from Eastbourne as they head to London to try and squeeze 28 women into a mini. This record requires amazing contortions.Â

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.sub-title: Mr Runner Up: My Life As An Oscar Bridesmaid Part 2
programme.desc: A candid docu-memoir of Hollywood Legend Jerry Wallach, and his forty year quest to win an Oscar. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addie has a meltdown on a school trip and finds a strange witch jar. Its the start of a life changing adventure full of friendship, frenemies, and a mystery that must be solved.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Freddy and Ivan have failed their runes exam and have to do it over - or they wont be allowed to attend the Doom Wolves concert. But their study session ends up putting themselves, and the Doom Wolves, in grave danger!

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: After daring each other to drink Chefs Pegasus Rainbow Latte, Izzy and Jude are jacked up like crazy and Duncan and Courtney take a road trip to try and replace the drink before Chef finds out its gone.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: The Maltos party after retrieving the last Embershard, but Mo forgot all about her history report due tomorrow! With Hashtag in tow, her simple research trip becomesÂ a wild adventure revealing what makes Witwicky so special.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Bumblebee offers to help Robin with his leadership skills, by teaching him how to act like a queen bee.

programme.title: Wordsville
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Disappearing Donuts
programme.desc: When donuts spelling the word SCRUMPTIOUS disappear from the bakery, Baker Graham is distraught because nothing in town can taste good until the word scrumptious is found. Luckily, the word detectives are on the case.

programme.title: Know It Alls: History
programme.desc: Chef Anna Polyvioux and Sienna go on culinary course through the ages, learning about the role that food played in the colonisation of Australia. Things are really heating this week on Know It Alls!

programme.title: The Ancient World Greece
programme.desc: Can you name a famous ancient Greek playwright or philosopher? Why is it so difficult to find documentation of life in ancient Greece written by women? We will look at the factors that stiffled most ancient Greek women.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets Mark along with his daughters, who plan to build a camping trailer from an old Saab, and inspirational teacher Busola who plans to create a cutting edge mobile classroom out of a double decker bus.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets Jasmine and Rupert, who plan to convert an old German fire truck into a cabin on wheels, and inspirational businessman Phil, whos spent thousands transforming an old fly-tipping site into a nature reserve.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Testing times as Trump talks up nuclear options for weapons and ending the government shutdown. Is NYC ready for a Democratic Socialist Mayor? Plus the other elections, and what Trumps deal with Xi did and didnt agree on.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Lewis delivers her sisters baby. Ross sees an old lover again, jeopardising his relationship with Diane. Carter rejects a position in the ER as he thinks hell be offered a surgical position. Benton receives some bad news.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway?
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts regulars Wayne Brady, Ryan Stiles and Colin Mochrie along with guest performer Gary Anthony Williams and star guest actress Jeanine Mason from the CWs Roswell, New Mexico.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addie bravely presents her memorial idea to the old-fashioned village council and in 16th century Juniper Maggie stands up to a fearsome witch-hunter.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Ms Afeaki leads the students on a camping trip, but when Scarlet and her family turn up on their own camping trip, Freddy and Scarlets granny end up cornered by wilderwolves and will need the whole classs help to escape!

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Duncan, Leshawna and Jude all want corner pieces of Izzys Birthday Cake... But are they prepared to go to any length to get one?

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: Mo and Hashtag warn their family about Starscreams master plan. Robby leads the Maltos in an attempt to stop the Decepticons once and for all, but Starscream still has a few devastating tricks up his sleeve.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Needing a hero with shrinking powers, Robin forgets about Bumblebee and invites the Atom to join their fight against the Brain.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Learn about what manga is and how to draw manga faces and expressions.

programme.title: Media Stamped
programme.desc: What song was playing under the last video you watched? Science shows that music can manipulate your feelings - even when you can hardly hear it! If you watch videos all day long, youre listening to them too.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Down Under
programme.desc: Todays mission takes Phil to Perth in Western Australia. But being down under has never been so challenging, as he tries to help a party girl whos extremely hard to satisfy.

programme.title: Fools Gold
programme.desc: Ex-lovers re-team in their search for a lost treasure-laden Spanish galleon. But hard on their heels are a former partner and a ruthless drug dealer who will stop at nothing to be the first to find the fortune.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Ssh! Upsy Daisys Having A Rest!
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy simply wants to rest in her bed but is disturbed by one character after another.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Zap sleeps in because his alarm clock is broken and none of his parcels get delivered. His friends all have a loud solution so that Zap wont sleep in ever again.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: At school, Teacher Harriet shows the class what to do to stay safe during a fire drill. While Daniel and his friends are playing, the fire alarm starts to ring, and the class practises their fire drill.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its music time at the creche and everyone wants a turn on the drum. Bing gets impatient waiting for his turn but as he tries to grab the drum from Sula he trips and breaks it. Now nobody can play the drum.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing with their bouncy ball. Suzy turns up with two tennis rackets and uses the bouncy ball to play a game of tennis with Peppa. George feels a bit left out until he is given the job of "ball boy".

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: After completing all his tasks, Bitzer is shocked to find the state of the barn and decides to help by tidying up. He has lots of difficulty trying to rehang a wonky picture, till the flock come up with their own solution.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the day of Pontypandys new Ocean Rescue Centre launch and Station Officer Steele is taking the firefighters on a tour of the centre. As they arrive on the quay, so does the new coastguard, Ben Hooper.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Everyone is visiting snooty King and Queen Marigolds Castle. King and Queen Marigold give them a tour which features a room made of ice sculptures and an upside down room.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Pedro Ponys birthday and he is having a superhero party. Pedro is dressed up like Super Potato and to Pedros surprise all the children are also dressed like Super Potato.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma dreams of seeing a baby whale and the cadets help her throw a whale concert to attract their attention.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard find some fascinatingly slippery fruit but bringing it safely back to the ship is more challenging than they imagined!

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Rachael and Teo get creative making swirly whirly marbling patterns on paper and fabric. They create a paper puppet world, and Teo uses the marbled fabric to make a fun hat to twist and shake in!

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Butterflies
programme.desc: When Nikhil sets out on a mission to spot butterflies, hes determined to do it alone. Will Jays butterfly fairy magic get in the way or help Nikhil after all?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When the Sound Collector finds a studio, he remembers when he was in a band!

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: The Bananas give Lulu a music box but it breaks down and so they have to find a way to fix it.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Explore music from around the world and learn with The Wiggles! Visit Athens with Lucia, travel to the Philippines with John, and stop by Ethiopia with Tsehay!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grampy Rabbit visits Peppas playgroup to talk about space rockets. The talk is going very well until suddenly Grampy Rabbit loses his voice. Can Doctor Brown Bear get him talking again?

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Koas nails are long and sharp, but hes afraid to cut them. Vida knows how to make it fun - nail polish!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Crafty Cuttlefish
programme.desc: The Octonauts are on a mission to recover Captain Barnacles lost Octo-compass, but its been taken by a crafty, shape-shifting Cuttlefish!

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton thinks Owlette stole a precious asteroid - but shes been framed by Romeo.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Emily longs for a bit of adventure and its not long before her wish is granted.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Millie and the kids search for tree branches and build a cubby from the branches and string and then plant a simple, beautiful garden around it. They have a picnic out front.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Enjoy good times with The Wiggles in this collection of Wiggle and Learn favourites, including Bin Night and Wake Up Lachy to sing along to!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to see a fish pond he used to visit when he was a little piggy. He is a little surprised to learn that a few things have changed since then.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Someone is causing mischief in the city. The PJMs blame the villains; the villains blame each other!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington, Jonathan and Judy decide to create a newspaper but they need afront page story!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mrs Figgs magic school has been damaged by a falling apple. A cake stall is arranged to pay for the repairs, but no one can eat Queen Thistles cakes.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Jealousy grows when Rocket Club meets "Galaxy Gang", a hotshot team of young alien space heroes who repeatedly arrive first in a series of deep space rescue missions.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos are playing their music so fast that everybody does everything very fast.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop has giant hiccups causing the whole town to rumble and shake, and making it impossible for him to fix anything. Bops friends come up with all sorts of suggestions for curing his hiccups.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Mom Go To The Market
programme.desc: Daniel and Mum Tiger are making a yummy breakfast at home when a mug falls and shatters. Daniel is about to help pick up the pieces, but his mum tells him to stop and listen to stay safe while she cleans up.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly - Voooooosh!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The night sky is fall of shining stars. Daddy Pig teaches Peppa and George how to find the North Star. The stars are far away and look very tiny. But when Peppa and George look through a telescope the stars look much bigger.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the prospect of the Farmers new golf course ruining their dump begins to become a reality, Shaun and the Flock have to resort to canny ways to save their prized resources.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: As twins Sarah and James can never agree on what kind of birthday party to have, Bronwyn has decided that this year they will have two parties. Jamess will be a science party and Sarahs will be a football party.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its the Twins birthday party and chaos ensues when their little friends arrive. The Wise Old Elf tries to entertain them, but they prove too much of a handful, turning the Wise Old Elf into a mouse.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and Suzy Sheep are spending a day helping Dr Hamster the Vet. They are learning all about what vets do.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: In an attempt to prove which is best - the beach or the bush - Gemma and Spyke take the Junior Junior Cadets on a fun day of adventure that almost ends in disaster.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard wants to have a go with Dads new drone but first he has to prove that he can go a whole day without breaking something precious. Good luck Big Lizard!

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Zindzi and Alex are decorating tucker boxes for the toys using bits and bobs from The Useful Box! Special guest Dave showcases his cake decorating skills, and we visit Humptys Sandwich Van for Build Your Own Sandwich Day!

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Turmeric Superpower
programme.desc: Jay gets turmeric on his hands and turns everything yellow! What if the whole world turns yellow with his turmeric superpower?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Is it too late for the Sound Collector to see the Seed Collector before winter?

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: The Bananas dream of travelling in a rocket ship and exploring outer space almost comes true.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles for a musical adventure exploring emotions! Sing along to Skidamarink and Whenever I Hear This Music, and explore how music makes us feel with Lachy and Dorothy the Dinosaur!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to see a fish pond he used to visit when he was a little piggy. He is a little surprised to learn that a few things have changed since then.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Juno cant wait for Juno-Mama Day, but Mama gets a cold. Vida teaches Juno to be a junior nurse instead!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When the Octopods waterworks are flooded with frightened Humuhumu fish, the Octonauts have to find a way to flush them out!

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Romeo needs the PJs help bringing his Flying Factory under control, but they dont trust him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Lorenzo plays a trick on his loyal coach, Beppe, but he discovers that taking the legendary opera star Dame Bella Canto to the music festival by himself isnt as fun as he thought it would be.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the kids are inspired by nature to create a green space that is for relaxation, reflection and mindfulness. Its a place to breathe in nature and forget about your worries.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Learn about the colours of the rainbow with The Wiggles! Help Simon, Anthony, and Wags the Dog sort their clothes by colour, and explore, sing, and dance through a colourful collection of songs! Its time to Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are on Snowy Mountain learning how to ski. Their teacher, Madame Gazelle, is very good at skiing and was once a world champion! But in the end it is Mummy Pig who impresses everyone...

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When an experiment goes wrong, Romeo tries to turn it to his advantage.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr. Gruber does a good turn for Paddington and says he can thank him by passing it on to someone else, which is harder than it sounds!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: A young witch is planning on moving into Mrs Witchs house. Mrs Witch has to come out of retirement to keep her place in the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: A whole episode dedicated to poo and what it does for the garden. Costa and the kids compare chicken and cow poo and set up an experiment to see what grows best in different poos.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Spicks returns with Ross Wilson, Andrea Lam, Ali McGregor, Frank Woodly and Urvi Majumdar all joining our favourite regulars Adam, Alan and Myf. Paul Kelly also belts out his sequel to How to Make Gravy.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Award-winning broadcaster Virginia Trioli explores the essence of creativity with some of our best loved artists at the peak of their powers. Virginias first guest is literary sensation Trent Dalton.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show
programme.desc: Its an all-female special on That Pacific Sports Show! Tiana and Sera celebrate women in sport with cricketer Melissa Velvel Fare and powerlifter Hani Watson.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Boyer Lecture Series
programme.desc: Larissa Behrendt outlines the strengths and pitfalls of our legal system, and how our democracy might be enriched by our First Nations peoples wisdom of interdependence in her talk Justice, Ideas and Inclusion.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Stateline
programme.desc: A push for NSW Police and government to change the way they deal with long-term missing persons cases. Plus South Australias coastal communities contemplate a very different summer, as the toxic algal bloom lingers.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: When you need to know whats going on across the country and around the globe, turn to Joe OBrien for a comprehensive roundup of the days news plus original reporting on the issues that affect you.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: The Reserve Bank has kept interest rates on hold at 3.6% after a higher than anticipated jump in inflation in the September quarter. Alicia Barry brings you the week in business and finance news.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.
